alert.note: Alert for Addison (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 16 at 9:49PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Vermont, including the following county, Addison. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect areas of standing water and ponding on area roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 946 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area over the next few hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... areas from Vergennes to Ferrisburgh. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
